page.title: 01ALVINGTON
page.content: Alvington, Glos., 100 ft above sea level, is a very rural area on the north bank of the Severn Estuary. In 1984 the total population was 612. It is a farming area, with three family owned farms mainly devoted to sheep and cattle. The village is old and in fact one of the farms, Alvington Court, was noted in the original Domesday Book. Housing is mainly old, modernised cottages, with one small Council Estate. The main Chepstow to Gloucester road, the A 48 runs through the middle of the village Amenities are virtually non existant and most activities and facilities occur in Aylburton and Lydney There is almost no employment in the area and therefore people who do have jobs have to commute.
